action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a side table, a couch, a shelf and a book. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a hallway, a kitchen and a bedroom here.
action.label: context

action.content:
> take plate  
Next actions: place plate on table  

Then, depending on where the mop is:

Suppose in bedroom:  
> go bedroom  
> take mop  
> return to living room  
> place mop on table  

Then handle the book:  
If needed, move from side table to main table.
action.label: response

content:

action.content: You can't see a plate here.
action.label: context

action.content:
You can't see a plate here.

> go hallway  
> look around  

If no plate is found there:  
> go kitchen  
> look around  

If still no plate:  
> go bedroom  
> take plate (if found)  
> return to living room
action.label: response
